title: (x) "Maison belle" detergent bottle label - hand lettered {Antonio Cavedoni}
content:
Does anyone know the font used in the name “Maison belle”?  
Thanks!

| Attachment | Size |
| --- | --- |
| [maisonbelle.jpg](http://web.archive.org/web/20080905043714/http:/typophile.com/files/maisonbelle.jpg) | 27.22 KB |

 [‹ (x) "Madeline and The Gypsies" brush-like lettering - similar to Cartoon Bold {Mike F}](http://web.archive.org/web/20080905043714/http:/www.typophile.com/node/41048 "Go to previous forum topic") [Royal Mail's inline geometric sans face/logo ›](http://web.archive.org/web/20080905043714/http:/www.typophile.com/node/40672 "Go to next forum topic")
author: ctchorz

comments.content: Not sure it’s a font, but if it is it must have a lot of OpenType alternates: see the two different e and l for example. It’s kind of hard to tell at this low a resolution, though.
